Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs. rude and unfriendly staff. exremely dirty. worst hotel ive ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: benvictoria
Reviews.Content: Staff ignore do not disturb signs. extremely dirty rooms. linen has holes. Fridge doesnt work. Door key doesnt work half the time. Absolute waste of money. Avoid at all costs

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: Central location (quick walk from Central station). Don't be put off by the need to ring a bell to get the door opened! The room was big and long and felt a bit like being in a New York apartment (in a good way!). It felt a bit like an IKEA showroom in parts and some of the veneers were coming off, but generally a good hotel (especially if you're not interested in a fancy TV or a fridge that really works). The restaurant downstairs sells great Asian food (Thai from memory) and is really cheap with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service and Scabby Room”
Reviews.Author: Jay O
Reviews.Content: The Valentine looks like a great hotel online but is not what it is made out to be! To park your car ($20 per night) you have to drive down a road and park in a dodgy car park and carry your bags back to the hotel. The service was very poor we had rude and unhelpful desk staff for the majority of our stay (the same person) when we asked if we could have some extra soap he was on his mobile phone and said that he would bring it up later which never happened. Also asking for a slightly longer checkout was denied as he said it was being used straight after us which seemed unlikely seeing as we were one of two in the whole hotel for three days. Pillows and bathroom were great, bed was two singles pushed together which made it uncomfortable when sleeping in the middle also not adequate sleeping covers on bed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, not 4.5 Stars though...”
Reviews.Author: A_Moose123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Valentine for my partner's birthday. Despite leaving instructions and calling through, there was no parking space guarenteed for our stay. After 15 minutes of fobbing around, I was finally provided with a parking token. Although our room was not ready as yet, staff were happy to hold our bags while I waiting for my partner to come from Canberra (I'd previously come up a few days prior). When we did go to check in however, nobody was at the service desk and we had to walk back into the City (which after a long day's drive was not overly ideal). Room was okay however when on the Wotif website, Standard King, did not equate to Standard room thus a little bit of disapointment on my part. Room was somewhat clean. Found someone else's lipgloss and random hair everywhere - a little weird. TV also kept malfunctioning and floors are very slippery when you get out of the shower. Also, King sized bed equates to 2 x King Single Beds pushed together which was a little strange for me. Unfortunate there was no choice of daily paper liken to other hotels. Other than that, room was sensible for the price and the other half seemed pleased with everything. Staff were polite and room cleaned daily. Would recommend this hotel to quick travellers who did not require a lot of "creature comforts"

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea R
Reviews.Content: Location was good, near shops and restaurants and China town, just opposite Korean buffet restaurant. I was hesitant to book this hotel because it had some bad reviews, but we went for it and enjoyed it. The room was very nice, although bathroom set up is funny and it does get wet, it's a hotel so we didn't mind that much, it was clean and very nice, the same with the bed and the room itself. Close to everything, a bit of a walk to Sydney Opera house and Circular Quay, but we don't mind that and there are free buses in Sydney. A bit expensive considering it doesn't offer breakfast but it's Sydney and all hotels are expensive there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomm!”
Reviews.Author: wicklowdreaming
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at Valentine on George. I read the reviews here and was quite concerned but thought I would give it a go. Glad I did. The room was clean and funky. Very quiet and warm and I had the best night sleep each night. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows extra nice - I wanted to take them home. For the price, the hotel is very good value and better than some more expensive hotels. Oh and the shower / wet room is gorgeous and the lighting is amazing. The service was welcoming and friendly and I enjoyed getting a paper delivered each morning. Pretty good location (right near Central station) and I walked into centre of CBD within 15 mins each morning. I am very fussy with accommodation so I was relieved when the negative reviews on this website did not match my experience. I would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: Please note this hotel is Self Rated Only and not 4.5 Stars as advertised on the website. An overall very disappointing experience. I regret not having read any reviews below prior to proceeding with my booking and will not be making the mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted and upset.”
Reviews.Author: juliasseizure
Reviews.Content: Anybody that would compliment or write a good review about this disgusting hotel, would only have something to lose. There was excrement from past visitors in the bathroom, as well as a half filled rubbish bin. There were jagged glass edges on lamp shades next to the bed. I hated my stay and would highly suggest anyone to reconsider making a booking at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Evicted for requesting blankets.”
Reviews.Author: trav_d126
Reviews.Content: I wish I was kidding. Picture a concrete floored room, a heater not in working order, nothing but marked sheets on the bed - and its the middle of winter.    Based on the hotel's advertisement on wotif/lastminute which boasts 'all the modern conveniences one would expect' and a '4.5 star' - self rating, the true conditions are a far cry from what would be expected from this so-called 'boutique hotel'.     It gets worse.    I live locally and booked 3 night accommodation to surprise my mother, who was visiting from NZ, with a weekend of concerts, spa treatments & shopping spent in the heart of Sydney, for this being her first visit to Australia.     My heart sunk as we drove down George street finally identifying our accommodation which looked nothing like the picture on their website, which was clearly taken at least 20 years before Valentine on George came to be. Cheap prints crudely held in place by masking tape in the foyer didn't inspire much confidence either. The staff at this hotel do not take pride in appearances.    Our rooms were barely habitable. A dirty toilet and shower with soap scum & used soap that had not been replaced since the last guest, no garbage bins in room, broken blinds, mismatched furnishings, exposed wires jutting out of holes in the wall and a fridge door that did not close so as to keep food at a safe temperature for consumption.    In a last ditch attempt to find some good in the situation, I ordered some room service from the hotel's restaurant of simple stir fries and deep fried entrees. Before making my order I confirmed specifically with staff that due to a prior booking we only had 45 mins before we had to leave to which I was assured our meals would be delivered in no longer than 20 mins. We waited 1 hour and 20 mins before our food arrived & staff could offer little explanation and I couldn't help but notice how empty the restaurant was.    Exhausted and uncomfortable, I retreated to bed. Not only was there no blanket, doona or bed spred but no blankets anywhere in the room. Perhaps I was expected to have brought my own? My attempts to request blankets from reception were met with hostility from the manager who told me that if I did not like the hotel that I could leave immediately. It was as though staff & management could not grasp the meaning of hospitality despite working in the industry.

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: 79lmac
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be closed down. I would hate to think anyone else would be subjected to the shocking conditions in this hotel where the staff & management are completely ill-equipped to handle any mode of customer service enquiry. Concrete floored rooms are devoid of blankets. You would not dare use the shower without wearing footware, and the excrement on the toilet lid was proof that basic hygiene is not a priority for this hotel. Once you get over the serious safety concerns, there is an incredible discomfort in the narrow, poorly lit rooms and the concrete floors make the room feel and resemble what I imagine a jail cell would be like. It is my first hand experience that there are several more than adequate & more affordable hotels in the area (see The Marque on George Street) and after a night spent in Valentine on George you will pretty much appreciate anything!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best first impression...”
Reviews.Author: Monique24
Reviews.Content: Our shuttle driver from the airport told us he only brings one or two people to Valentine on George each month so we weren't sure whether that was good or bad! When checking in, the receptionist seemed to be also looking after four children.. They were all over the reception desk, computer, running around, really noisy and all the while being told off by the lady on reception (we assumed they were here kids). We like kids, but thought this was a bit odd for a hotel. The room was ok - interesting furniture & lighting, comfortable bed & pillows, clean bathroom with good shower pressure although the shower head wouldn't stay up. But.. lots of scuff marks on the walls, very small tv with a remote that barely worked & aerial broken, towel rail fell off the wall, only sheets on the bed so was freezing at night. Could hear everything said in the corridoor, and a lot from the next door room too. In saying that, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room so we were in a great location to walk to Darling harbour & great shopping & restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Happy enough, especially after reading reviews on here.”
Reviews.Author: MozartCat
Reviews.Content: I booked Valentine on George through one of the accommodation websites - a standard room with a king size bed for about $140. Looking at the photo's etc, I thought it was a very good deal, until I started to read the reviews on here. I thought I had made a mistake but booking and paying for the room and wasn't overly looking forward to my night in Sydney. I was very surprised. After reading the reviews, I thought I would be spending the night in something close to a dog kennel, but I was more than happy with the quality of the room (no it isn't new), cleanliness (sure there is some old stains here and there, how many of this rating don't - but it was very clean!), and also the staff were helpful. As mentioned below, the TV was small, but I didn't intend on sitting in the room all the time, so it did the job when I needed some down time. Bed was firm and comfortable, pillows were good. My GPS had no issue finding the hotel, though having to park illegally in Valentine St in order to get my card park card from reception concerned me. Location was perfect, 5 minutes walk to the Convention Centre, Paddys (crappy) Markets and 10 easy minutes to Darling Harbour. I was on the 4th floor, so there was little to no street noise, though with the hard floors, I think if someone was in the rooms above and next to me, it may have been noisey due to foot traffic. Would definately stay there again midweek in the same standard room. Maybe I'm not as fussy as others.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, disappointing, disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mezzat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only a short walk from central station. However, the hotel front door is on Valentine st, a small one way lane that most taxi drivers would not know about and difficult for them to find. I had high expectations as a friend had recommended this place, the manager was friendly but we found out by the end of the trip that she was also the only person that has any clue about what is going on. It appears that the hotel has 3 suites on each floor, and apparently the '1' suite of each floor is the corner suite and a bit more spacious than the others (we found out by the end of the stay). The impression of our room overall was quite disappointing. The room had an strange smell. The blank walls were once white and were covered in smudges and stains. A rather sterile feel to the room. The blind was old and dusty. A rather odd mix of designer furniture did not make the place 'boutique'. An outdated Bang and Olfusen television (the old traditional box TVs) crowded the corner of the room. There was also a hole in the corner of the wall where electrical cords and wires were hanging from. The inbuilt seating along the wall had stains on the cushions. The bathroom was dirty. There were yellow drip stains on the side of the sink. There were handprints on the mirror. The shower head would not stay up, only redeeming feature was that the water pressure was good. The towels were old and had holes in it, and the pillowcase was torn. When they serviced the room, they took took the soap and did not replace it! The door did not provide much noise protection, in the morning when house keeping was servicing the other rooms, I could hear everything that was going on. I can't believe this hotel is self-rated 4.5 stars on wotif.com.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: siienka
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Valentine on George early September. Checked in smoothly, front desk staff were friendly. Rooms were funky but decor looked a bit run down, cushions & curtains needed cleaning, TV was too small, no wine glasses to accompany our bottle of wine, blankets were not warm enough even after using the extra supplied. The walls are not sound proof so could clearly hear the cleaners talking loudly & entering the cleaning closet outside our room early in the morning. The bathroom was beautiful though, loved the quality of the toiletries, the room spray & the complimentary slippers were also a bonus. Lovely little boutique hotel in a great location though wouldn't stay here again as it doesn't compare to other quality hotels in the area for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience -- Odd Smell, bad service”
Reviews.Author: SunshineAnita
Reviews.Content: Don't trust what website says. This hotel is terrible. The room is terrbile -- with odd smell, uncleaned spoons, hairs on the pillows, air-condition doesn't work at all, no duvet (quilt), noisy like sleep on the street, damaged fridge, no litter bin in the room, etc...(the room we checked-in called 'heritage room'); The service is terrible too -- there's no answer after 12am, cannot handle / deal with the clients' in time... The hotel is nothing to do with 'Boutique Hotel' at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGeelong
Reviews.Content: We have just checked out from 4 nights at the Valentine on George we had a twin bedroom and could honestly not complain about a thing. This hotel is excellent value for money, the staff were all very helpful and the room was always cleaned to perfection. I would highly reccomend this hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: debiCanberra
Reviews.Content: We chose the Valentine on George as it was close to the Entertainment Center and we were going to a concert. The booking process with the Hotel was arduous. Many phone calls for confirmation etc. The Hotel is very discreet from George Street (as stated before it is on Valentine Street ) and if you are driving from the City Center you cant turn left for ages (beware). The standard King Room is adequate for the price but also as stated before full of basic design faults. My partner said immediately that it must have been designed by a 1st year student and trust me that is his area of expertise. It was clean close to where we had to go cheap and quirky. I will post a photo of the TV. I spent a good 5 minutes looking for it and the phone was really cool as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: missprints
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Valentine a few times now. It is great value for such a central location in Sydney. It has a small number of rooms, so has a boutique feel - especially with the mid-century furniture. Despite it being just off George Street, there is no street noise. We did get a bit of noise from the lifts & other rooms on the floor though. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance - Chinatown, Spanish Quarter, Darling Harbour, etc. Paddys Market is just a few minutes away. The hotel is very close to Central Station - two blocks to the main entrance, or just one block if you walk via the pedestrian underground. Some of the other comments mention poor customer service, however we have always found the staff friendly and responsive. On our most recent visit we noticed a few rough edges, mainly in the bathroom (loose towel rail, shelf, etc) but nothing to detract from our overall impression. I recommend The Valentine, and plan to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not such great service...”
Reviews.Author: tigerliliy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at valentine on george for 6 nights in August 2009. There was 5 of us and we had the terrace suite and the standard suite. Positive points were that the location was great, so close to cbd and train station which will get you just about anywhere in sydney. The beds and pillows were super comfortable!The rooms were quite cool and stylish but definitly favours form over function! Low points of the standard suite were.. the bathroom is a 'wet room' ie open shower (no walls) so consequently after someone has had a shower the whole bathroom floor is wet so cant use to change clothes in etc. Also the top toilet seat was missing so toilet gets all wet as it is right next to shower... also may sound a bit pedantic but the towel rail was ridiculously low so the big bath sheet/towels they give you can barely be hung up... and across the mirror the words ''Ellie is a Pig" was sort of stained across the mirror(very strange?!?!) Our tv would sometimes not turn on and we had to get reception to come and fix this twice. When we got there the internet was not working for the first day and twice also we had to ring down to reception to ask for toilet paper as the cleaners never left any spare. Also when we got to our room the phone was turned to silent so we missed a bunch of phone calls which was really annoying. Each day the room was serviced they never did anything other than make the beds and change our towels - during our whole stay they never vacuumed or wiped down any surfaces..lastly the receptionist that was on most days was totally unfriendly... when we checked out and paid our combined bills of over $2000 she didnt even thank us, barely even spoke to us during whole transaction and honestly, I could understand if we were real complainers/horrible guests etc but we were just normal everyday tourists and we hadn't complained once. ON THE OTHER HAND... The terrace suite was really quite lovely and the cleaners thoroughly cleaned this suite each day .It had 2 massive bedrooms and 2 big bathrooms (Although we had asked for 2 queen beds and on arrival found 2 singles + 1 queen and when we rung to ask them to change it they did it the next day.and there ) Only thing that let it down was it had light beige carpet that had masses of stains and two large red wine stains in lounge and bedroom.So in conclusion I basically got the impression from this hotel that its not worth staying here unless you have the more expensive rooms and in which case if you've got the money I'd advise taking your money somewhere else due to the lack of hospitality we found:) Also side note the room service is from the asian restaurant downstairs so consequently only available during their opening hours and they are closed Sundays

Reviews.Title: “Great value lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollyGolightlyUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week whilst taking in the sights and sounds in and around Sydney. With the cost of a King room being such great value for money ($130) we thought there must be a catch. However, on checking in on our first day we were pleasantly surprised to find clean, modern, well equiped rooms and friendly staff. We ate in the downstairs restaurant one evening and that was lovely too - sort of like an independant Wagamama - with the added bonus of 15% discount for guests and BYO! There were nice touches such as towling robes, slippers, and nice toiletries that I would have expected to find only in a more expensive hotel. One small drawback was the location. It was about a 25-30 minute walk to Circular Quay, and about 15 minutes to Darling Harbour - so not too far, but not on the doorstep either. However, taxis are affordable and there are regular busses that head in the right direction. Basically this place was cheaper than the Travelodge, but, in my opinion, far nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: EmDanLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money - great central location, big modern, clean rooms and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “More stylish than practical, but good hotel”
Reviews.Author: espertus
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the hotel. We chose it because of the TripAdvisor reviews, because it was near the Central train station, and because it had Internet access. The location was very good for us not just because of the train access but because it was in walking distance to so many different parts of Sydney. Our room was quiet, despite being near a noisy street, and it had a refrigerator large enough for us to store items (in addition to the minibar items, which we ignored). The staff was friendly and helpful. The modern decor did not appeal to us, both aesthetically and because it was poorly designed. For example, the one towel bar was too small and low to properly dry towels, and it was over the toilet paper, causing wet items to drip on it. The sliding bathroom door made a lot of noise and could wake a sleeping partner. The large bed was made of two twin mattresses, but they must have been well attached because they stayed together, and the bed was comfortable. We would have saved money if we'd booked directly with the hotel, instead of through a hotel website, but the price was still reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, not great eaither”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: I read reviews here after I booked. comments about cleanliness got me somewhat worried. In the end, it was not bad. On the other hand, while the decoration was trendy at one point, it would seem it is now anywhere between 2 and 5 years old, it is slowly starting to deteriorate. This sort of almost overdone trendiness tends not to age well. also, in some respects, it stands in the way of functionality. Thinking for example of the sink, with is far away of the towels, details like that. TV is outdated, in a decor that otherwise goes for as sharp as can be. In addition, location, more or less in the middle of Chinatown, is not terribly good. I booked there rather than close to the airport because it was close to the train station, and I thought, a quick train ride is better than having to wait for a hotel shuttle, plus we'll be in the city. Now, this is not the hotel's fault, but the price of the train ride to/from SYD is ridiculously steep, at $14/person, especially if you are two. But anyway, this does detract from the location.

Reviews.Title: “Unique & Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: siiroc
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, lots of charm in a great location with service par excellence. I spent three nights in the standard double room which was well appointed with tasteful and elegant fittings throughout. Quality of the fittings was well up there also; (B&O telephone, BOSE sound system, touch switches, frameless glass shower... ). I opted for car parking, which although is located in a separate complex to the hotel is secure and <2mins walk away. The hotel does explicitly state that there is limited car parking availability and recommends requesting this prior to your stay (I reserved a spot one week beforehand, no hassles). I found the service warm and professional, greeted every morning as I left to go out and were always helpful to any requests that I had. Location is very good also, in Chinatown itself, but about 10mins walk to Darling Harbour and within walking distance of George St. bars and nightclubs. Bonus perks include free in-room broadband internet access and complimentary newspaper. The cleanliness I found to be below the otherwise high standards of the VOG. While by no means filthy per se, attention could have been paid to the grubby marks on the walls, sticky (and unknown) residue around the bathroom vanity counter and dust around some of the more obscure places. Also, I was staying with a friend who had booked another double room directly adjacent. Whilst that room was endowed with mostly the same fittings, it was considerably smaller and darker. It might therefore be worthwhile requesting one of the 'corner' rooms (in my case, 401). But yes, overall very satisifed with my stay at the VOG. It's atmospheric 'charm' and customer service were definite highlights and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Valentine for five nights and had a fantastic time there the room was modern boutiqe style with a great shower area and lots of space to move around in with little quirky touches to make it special i.e a bose sound system. For all its location in the heart of Sydney we slept well every night (and I and my partner are light sleepers). The staff were always courteous and helpfull and the sights and heart of the city were all within walking distance China town round the corner litteraly, Darling Harbour 20mins stroll, we would recomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in over 20 Sydney hotels of varying price / value and Valentine on George is probably the best value hotel I have come across. I stayed in a King suite and was given a very clean, modern and stylish room. There was some nice touches - like Bang & Olufsen phones, large bath sheets, a scented room mist, Bose tv and very well thought out lighting. In addition, the bathroom was lovely and modern, with a strong and easily temperature adjusted shower - this can be hard to find!! The service was courteous and professional. A downside was the hotel parking - about 50 metres down the road in a rabbit warren complex that was hard to navigate. Reception said that the majority of their complaints was about parking. As a small boutique hotel, they do not have some usual hotel facilities (such as a pool or gym) but if you are willing to forgo this, its perfect. I paid $170 for one night on Mardi Gras weekend - which represented excellent value. Will make this a regular stay when I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: amleggett
Reviews.Content: When there are over 200 hotels in Sydney to choose from it means hours sitting on sites like Tripadvisor looking for some helpful suggestions on where to stay. I was at a bit of an advantage when I started looking for somewhere in the city having been to Sydney 3 times before. I knew I wanted to be down the Chinatown/Darling Harbour end of the city and homed in on the George St / Pitt St area. Valentine on George is a little hidden treasure. The taxi driver did have a bit of a job trying to find it, its on a little one way street off George St which is always handy to let the cabby know. Its pretty much opposite the 790 on George (a huge backpackers). There are only a handful of rooms here and couple of suites, which I'm sure would be equally as lovely. The view is not the best out the window but the inside of the room is so funky and hip you don't want to spend time looking out of it. Very modern place and very quiet which is a blessing in a busy bustling city. Beautiful wet-tiled bathroom. Magical lighting system as well. About a 5-10min stroll to Darling Harbour and a short walk to Hyde park where you can get buses to the Quay/Bondi/Coogee. The only downside was that the staff were a little bit clueless when I asked about localities of places, like the laundrette, how to get to Bondi (the guy on the desk said we had to get a cab, no buses went there! which I knew was a lie as I had jumped on one before!) Other than that it was a great stay. Would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Creative space - Almost too good to share”
Reviews.Author: Blacklisted
Reviews.Content: Valentine On George has such hip rooms at great rates that I almost don't want to tell the VT world in case it gets too popular and drops its standards and raises its prices. At the moment, the prices are generally moderate but amazingly cheap for such high design values. The rooms are very trendy, suitably romantic and extremely large. The bathroom is stocked with good quality toiletries and is a joy to look at and use. Everything was very clean and dust free in my stay. There are a host of really smart design features: high end sound system, concealed TV, properly sealed doors, high cealings and a curtain to easily hide your ugly luggage and shoes. There are some things that could be annoying. The bed is stiff but the soft pillows combine to make sleep comfy. There is road noise and light leaking into the room throughout the night. The TV is not very functional and the bench cushions slide around and provide no back comfort. The concrete floor works for me but I always like them. The place is dimly lit but there is task lighting where it's needed. I totally agree with the positive reviews of the restaurant on the ground floor. It is unbeatable for value and the meals are delicious and amazingly presented. It's all in keeping with the smart creativity of the whole place. The photos I've seen others post and the hotel use are pretty accurate. Apart from romantic holidays, it would be great for business or exteneded stays.

HotelInfo.Name: Valentine On George
HotelInfo.Address: 767 - 769 George Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000 , Australia
